Xi Jinping:
Xi Jinping was born on June 15, 1953 in Beijing, China.  He was born into a political family: his father, Xi Zhongxun, was a high-ranking member of the Communist Party of China.  From a young age, Xi Jinping showed outstanding abilities and interest in politics. 

In 1969, during the Cultural Revolution, Xi Jinping was sent to isolation in the rural countryside of Shandong province.  There he worked in a collective farm and witnessed the harsh living conditions that prevailed in China at that time.  This may have influenced his desire for social justice and improvement of the lives of ordinary people. 

Xi Jinping began his political career in 1974 when he joined the Communist Party of China.  In 1980, he was appointed Deputy Secretary of the Party Committee in Hebei province, and later transferred to Fujian province.  In 1999, he was appointed Governor of Fujian province, where he demonstrated his leadership qualities and ability for effective organizational management. 

In 2002, Xi Jinping was appointed Governor of Jiangsu province and at the same time became a member of the Standing Committee of the Politburo of the Communist Party of China.  In 2007, he became the head of the party and finally confirmed his leadership. 

Xi Jinping was elected President of the People's Republic of China in 2013.  He introduced significant reforms in various areas, such as the economy, judicial system, anti-corruption policy, and international relations.  In 2018, the Communist Party of China made amendments to its constitution, removing the two-term limit for presidency and allowing Xi Jinping to remain in office for a longer term. 

As the leader of China, Xi Jinping continues to strengthen the position of the Communist Party of China and strives for the economic and political development of the country.  He also actively pursues foreign relations policies and seeks to enhance China's international influence. 

Xi Jinping is married and has a daughter.  He is described as an energetic leader, devoted to the ideals of the socialist system, and striving to make China even more prosperous and strong on a global scale.
Narendra Modi:
Narendra Modi, full name Narendra Damodardas Modi, was born on September 17, 1950 in the Indian state of Gujarat.  He is a political figure in India, the leader of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), and the current Prime Minister of India, having held this position since May 2014. 

Modi grew up in a poor family, his father worked on the railway and his mother was a homemaker.  Since then, Narendra has shown entrepreneurial inclinations and was interested in organizing local activities. 

In the 1970s, Modi joined the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), a radical paramilitary organization of Indian nationalism, to fight for political stability in the country and national unity.  It was during this time that he began his political career and joined the BJP. 

Over time, Modi became one of the prominent faces of the BJP, known for his leadership qualities and strong political will.  He became the Chief Minister of Gujarat in 2001 and served in this position for four terms.  Under his leadership, the state flourished in various areas including industry, agriculture, and infrastructure. 

In 2014, Modi led the BJP to victory in the national elections and became the Prime Minister of India.  His campaign promised strong leadership, economic reforms, and a fight against corruption in the Indian government.  After winning the elections, Modi became the Prime Minister of India. 

As Prime Minister, Modi promotes the "Make in India" policy to boost the country's industrial development and attract foreign investments.  He has also focused on the development of rural areas, launching social security schemes, and introducing digital technologies in governance. 

However, his tenure has also been challenged by many who accuse him of a illiberal approach to freedom of speech and minorities, as well as of weakening the environment and increasing inequality. 

Narendra Modi remains one of the influential and debated figures in Indian politics.  His charismatic personality, charisma, and bold reforms continue to attract attention both inside and outside India.
Joko Widodo:
Joko Widodo, whose full name is Joko Widodo Sudjatmiko, is a well-known Indonesian politician and human rights activist.  He was born on August 21, 1961 in Manado, on the island of Sulawesi, Indonesia. 

Widodo started his political career in the early 1990s when he was elected as a member of the student council at the University of Indonesia.  He later became a member of the National Student Association of Indonesia and actively participated in political activities at the national level. 

He is known for his efforts in the field of human rights protection and anti-corruption.  From 2005 to 2015, he served as the director of the Legal Aid Institute of Indonesia (Lembaga Bantuan Hukum Indonesia) - an organization that represents and defends the rights of the underprivileged and vulnerable groups in Indonesia. 

In 2012, Widodo was elected to the Indonesian Parliament from the party "NasDem" (National Democratic Party).  He was elected as the Vice President of the Parliament and held this position from 2012 to 2014.  In 2014, he became the Minister of Village Development in the cabinet of President Joko Widodo.  Later on, he also held the position of Minister of Social Affairs in the same cabinet. 

Joko Widodo's biography is characterized by his active work in defending human rights and promoting democracy in Indonesia.  He fulfills multiple duties and holds key positions in the government while continuing to fight against inequality, corruption, and other social issues in the country.  His activities and dedication have earned him respect and recognition at the national and international levels.

Sheikh Hasina:
Sheikh Hasin, whose full name is Abdul Hasan ibn Abdul Razzak ibn Muhammad Hasan, was born on January 17, 1966 in the city of Karak, Jordan.  He is a prominent religious figure and scholar, the imam and sheikh of the Al-Hashimiya mosque. 

Sheikh Hasin received his education in spiritual schools, studying the Quran and Islamic philosophy.  He underwent training under the guidance of renowned sheikhs and scholars, as well as studied Islamic jurisprudence.  His deep knowledge and understanding of the Islamic faith, combined with his kindness and tolerance, have made him a respected and influential figure in his community. 

Sheikh Hasin is also an active preacher and public speaker.  He often gives religious sermons and participates in discussions on important matters of Islam and society.  His speeches and sermons are characterized by clarity, depth, and elevated wisdom. 

He is popular not only among Muslims but also among the wider public.  Sheikh Hasin aims to instruct and inspire people, calling for peace, tolerance, and compassion.  He actively participates in charity projects and helps those in need. 

Sheikh Hasin is also known for his contributions to Islamic literature.  He has written several books, including commentaries on the Quran and religious texts, which have become highly popular among scholars and ordinary believers. 

One of his key principles is the pursuit of truth and understanding of various cultures and religions.  He preaches tolerance, cooperation, and peaceful coexistence with Muslims and representatives of other religious and ethical traditions. 

Sheikh Hasin is considered a leading religious authority and moral figure in his society.  His contributions to the study and dissemination of Islam and its religious practices are invaluable.  Sheikh Hasin has dedicated his life to serving art, people, and truth, and continues to be an influential figure in his country and beyond.
Shinzo Abe:
Shinzo Abe was born on September 21, 1954 in Tokyo, Japan.  He is a Japanese politician and is considered one of the most influential and long-serving prime ministers of Japan. 

Shinzo Abe is the second son and the grandnephew of Japan's Prime Minister Shinobu Nobusuke Kishi.  His father, Shintaro Abe, was also a politician and the Abe family belongs to Japan's political elite. 

Shinzo Abe received his education in the arts at Yale University in the United States.  Upon returning to Japan, he began his political career and quickly rose to several high-ranking positions. 

In 2006, Abe became the leader of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan (LDP) and assumed the position of prime minister.  However, due to health issues, he was forced to resign shortly after his appointment. 

In 2012, Abe returned to politics and once again became the leader of the LDP.  In December of the same year, he won the elections and became the prime minister of Japan. 

Under Shinzo Abe's leadership, Japan became more active in foreign policy, especially in its relations with other Asian countries.  He also focused on the economic development of Japan, implementing reforms aimed at stimulating growth and strengthening the Japanese economy. 

One of Abe's most significant achievements was the adoption of "Abenomics" in 2013, an economic package designed to combat deflation and promote growth in the Japanese economy.  Abenomics received widespread support and yielded some positive results. 

Shinzo Abe also participated in various other organizations, such as the Group of Seven (G7), the United Nations (UN), and others. 

However, his tenure was not without controversies and criticism from the opposition.  Critics accuse him of nationalist rhetoric and of being unable to effectively address issues such as low birth rates and an aging population. 

Despite this, Shinzo Abe remains one of the longest-serving prime ministers of Japan and leaders in the Asian region.  His contribution to Japanese politics and economy will remain significant and memorable.
Benigno Aquino III:

Tr\u01b0\u01a1ng T\u1ea5n Sang:
Truong Tan Sang was born on February 21, 1949 in the province of Ben Tre, Vietnam.  He was one of five children in a family of farmers and grew up in rural areas.  From an early age, Sang showed a great interest in politics and issues affecting his country. 

In 1967, he joined the Revolutionary Army of the People of Vietnam and participated in many military actions during the Vietnam War.  Through his intelligence, insight, and dedication to his country, Sang quickly rose through the ranks and became a battalion commander. 

After the war, Sang began his political career.  He became an active member of the Communist Party of Vietnam and held various positions in the government and the party.  In 2006, he was elected as the first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam. 

In 2011, Truong Tan Sang became the President of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.  During his presidency, he actively worked on modernizing the economy and developing Vietnam's external relations.  He focused on attracting foreign investments, expanding foreign trade, and cooperating with other countries. 

One of Sang's most significant achievements was the signing of the Friendship and Cooperation Treaty between Vietnam and the United States in 2013.  This treaty opened a new chapter in the relations between the two countries and led to the strengthening of economic, trade, and political ties. 

Truong Tan Sang also actively worked on strengthening relations with other countries in Asia and Europe.  He visited many countries and established long-term partnerships that contributed to Vietnam's development. 

Truong Tan Sang left a huge mark on the political and historical life of Vietnam.  He was praised for his efforts in developing the country, strengthening external relations, and modernizing the economy.  Sang remains a prominent figure in the history of Vietnam and will be remembered as a leader who brought prosperity and stability to his country.
Recep Tayyip Erdo\u011fan:
Recep Tayyip Erdogan was born on February 26, 1954 in the village of Kasimpasa, located on the coast of the Black Sea province of Rize, in the family of poor entrepreneurs.  He was the fourth child in the family, and his father Ahmet Raif Erdogan worked as a sailor.  Recep began his childhood in this village, where he became known for his love of football. 

In 1965, Erdogan entered a technical school in Istanbul.  There he became interested in politics and organizing student movements.  In the 1970s, during his student years, he joined the youth organization "Nasuhiyirvani" (On Guard), which supported conservative Islamic principles. 

In 1984, Erdogan joined the Welfare Party due to his social activism and ability to organize people.  But after the party was banned in 1982, he continued his political activities in the Virtudian Democratic Party. 

In 1994, Erdogan was elected mayor of Istanbul, a huge metropolis that became a key point in his political career.  At that time, he focused on modernizing the city and improving its infrastructure.  Under his leadership, Istanbul underwent significant changes and became one of the most modern cities in the region.  Erdogan served as mayor for eight years, becoming the first successor re-elected for a third term. 

In 2001, the Justice and Development Party (AKP) was created, represented by Erdogan.  The party received significant support in the 2002 elections and won 363 seats in the parliament out of 550.  As a result, Erdogan became the Prime Minister of Turkey. 

During his time in power, Erdogan implemented a number of important infrastructure projects, such as the construction of new bridges, tunnels, airports, and other facilities.  He also carried out a series of political reforms aimed at strengthening democracy and human rights. 

However, Erdogan's political career has been marked by criticism from the opposition and some international organizations for violating democratic principles, freedom of speech, and human rights.  In addition, his decision to move from Prime Minister to President has sparked disputes about his aspirations for undemocratic power. 

Recep Tayyip Erdogan continues his political activities as the President of Turkey and in recent years has actively promoted his "Great Turkish Nation" on both domestic and international fronts.  He remains one of the most influential and controversial figures in modern politics.
Hassan Rouhani:
Hassan Rouhani, whose full name is Hassan Fereidun Rouhani, was born on January 12, 1948 in the city of Sardou, Iran.  He is known as an Iranian politician and religious figure who was elected President of Iran in 2013. 

Rouhani began his political career in 1979 after the Islamic Revolution, which overthrew the Pahlavi dynasty and established an Islamic republic in Iran.  During these years, he held various positions, including member of parliament and advisor to the president. 

In 2013, Rouhani announced his intentions to run for the presidency of Iran.  His campaign was supported by masses of Iranians who desired greater openness and reforms in the country.  Upon becoming president, Rouhani promised to pursue a policy of "moderation and progress" and make Iran more open to the international community. 

During his first term, Rouhani focused on easing relations with the international community, particularly regarding Iran's nuclear program.  In 2015, an agreement was reached between Iran and six world powers on the nuclear program, leading to the lifting of many international sanctions. 

In 2017, Rouhani was re-elected for a second term with overwhelming support from the Iranian people.  This time, his priorities included economic reforms and expanding civil freedoms in the country.  He also continued efforts to improve relations with the international community and attract foreign investments. 

Hassan Rouhani remains a key figure in the Islamic Republic of Iran, leading the country through significant challenges and transitions.  His presidency is characterized by a commitment to reforms and protecting the interests of the Iranian people.  At the same time, his personal and political religiosity continues to play an important role in his decision-making and governance approach.
Prayut Chan-o-cha:
Phraut Chan-O-Cha is a talented actor, director, and screenwriter from Thailand.  He was born on August 12, 1987 in Bangkok. 

Since childhood, Chan-O-Cha has been passionate about art and dreamed of becoming an actor.  In 2004, he enrolled in the Thai Academy of Arts and began studying acting.  Soon he became one of the most talented students in his group. 

In 2006, Chan-O-Cha got his first role in the film "Once in Thailand".  His sincere acting and charisma on screen did not go unnoticed, and he quickly gained popularity among audiences in Thailand and beyond. 

In the following years, Phraut Chan-O-Cha starred in many well-known films and television series such as "Ghost in the House" (2008), "Escape" (2010), "Beloved Student" (2013), and others.  His acting talent and ability to embody different characters earned him recognition both in Thailand and abroad. 

In 2015, Chan-O-Cha starred in the film "Ong-Bak 3", where he not only played the lead role but also served as director and screenwriter.  The film was a huge success and brought Chan-O-Cha even more fame and critical acclaim.

He is an ambassador for the University of Wildlife and Animal Nature of Thailand and constantly contributes to nature conservation and environmental protection. 

Phraut Chan-O-Cha is a bright and talented personality with a significant contribution to the Thai film industry.  His creativity and social activism have made him an icon and gathered fans worldwide.  In his work, he continues to delight audiences with his vivid and memorable roles, as well as to advocate for nature and animal rights.
Thein Sein:
Teyn Seyn (real name - Mark Aleksandrovich Livshits) is a Russian rap artist, songwriter, and producer.  He was born on September 7, 1997 in Moscow, Russia. 

Since childhood, Teyn has shown an interest in music.  In his youth, he began to learn to play the guitar and gradually mastered various genres.  However, his true passion has always been hip-hop and rap.  It was in this genre that he decided to develop and express his thoughts and emotions through music. 

In 2014, Teyn Seyn officially debuted on the music scene with the song "Budushchee" (Future).  This was the beginning of his professional career.  Soon after, he released his first studio album titled "Yad" (Poison).  The album received positive reviews from critics and attracted the attention of a wide audience. 

With each new release, Teyn Seyn expanded his horizons and fan base.  His lyrics were open and sincere, making listeners reflect and empathize with him.  The themes of his songs covered various aspects of life - from love and relationships to social issues and politics.

Teyn Seyn continues to create and evolve as a musician.  He constantly experiments with sound and style, surprising listeners with his creative boldness.  His songs become more mature and profound, reflecting his own personal growth and development.

With each new track and album, Teyn Seyn continues to increase his popularity and win over new fans with his unique style and energy.
Park Geun-hye:
Park Kyung-hye (born December 30, 1982) is a South Korean actress.  She began her career in the entertainment industry in the early 2000s and has since become one of the most famous and in-demand actresses in Korea. 

Born and raised in Seoul, Park Kyung-hye showed interest in acting from a young age.  After graduating from high school, she enrolled in a university of theater and film, where she earned a bachelor's and master's degree in the arts. 

In 2003, Park Kyung-hye made her cinematic debut in the film "The Happy Life".  Her talent and charisma were noticed by critics and fans, leading to her rapid rise in the industry.  In 2004, she received the "Nagging Wife" award at the national film awards, confirming her talent and professionalism. 

Over time, Park Kyung-hye expanded her acting range by appearing in various genres and projects.  She successfully handles comedic, dramatic, and even historical roles, demonstrating her ability to adapt to different genre requirements. 

In 2009, Park Kyung-hye landed her first leading role in the TV series "Brilliant Legacy".  The show was a huge success and brought her international recognition.  Her talent and appeal helped her become one of the top actresses in South Korea. 

In the following years, Park Kyung-hye continued to delight her fans with new projects, including the films "My Annoying Brother" (2016) and "Midnight Runners" (2017), as well as the dramas "Healer" (2014) and "The K2" (2016). 

In addition to her acting career, Park Kyung-hye is actively involved in charitable events and supports various social and environmental issues.

Fuad Masum:
Fuad Masum was born on January 1, 1938, in the city of Kela in northern Iraq.  He received his primary education at a local school and then entered the University of Baghdad, where he studied law and political science. 

After graduating from university, he began his professional career as a lawyer and soon became a well-known jurist in Iraq.  Masum also actively participated in the country's political life and joined the Kurdistan Democratic Party. 

In 1992, Masum was elected to the Iraqi National Council, where he served as vice president.  In 2003, after the overthrow of President Saddam Hussein, Masum became one of the influential politicians in Iraq. 

In 2014, Masum was elected President of Iraq, becoming the first Kurd to hold this position.  During his presidency, he worked actively to ease internal political tensions and unite various ethnic groups in the country. 

Fuad Masum also played an active role in international affairs and was recognized as a peacemaker.  He was known for his efforts to find political solutions to conflicts in Iraq and assist the population in rebuilding after a long war. 

However, his presidency was marred by growing terrorist threats from the Islamic State.  In 2018, Masum declined to extend his presidential term, handing over the position to Haider al-Abadi. 

Fuad Masum remains one of the influential political leaders in Kurdistan and Iraq, as well as a prominent defender of the rights and interests of the Kurdish people.  He continues to actively engage in political activities and strive for peace and stability in Iraq.
Ashraf Ghani:
Ashraf Ghani was born on February 28, 1947, in Peshawar, Pakistan.  He became a prominent Afghan politician and activist, elected as the President of Afghanistan after the country was liberated from the Taliban regime in 2001. 

Ghani was born into a distinguished Afghan family.  His father was a supporter of the Afghan National Party, and his mother was a school teacher.  In his youth, he studied in Pakistan, where he obtained a bachelor's degree in economics. 

After completing his education, Ghani received a scholarship and went to the United States, where he obtained a master's degree in anthropology and a doctorate in economics.  During his years of study, he acquired deep knowledge in economic development and social sciences. 

Ghani began his political career in 2001 when he was appointed as the UN Special Envoy for Afghanistan.  In this role, he played a vital role in the country's reconstruction after the fall of the Taliban regime.  He also held high positions in the Afghan government, including the positions of Finance Minister and Planning Minister. 

In 2014, Ghani ran for President of Afghanistan and won, becoming the first president of the country to be elected through democratic elections.  He continued his work on the renewal and development of Afghanistan, focusing on economic development, fighting corruption, and strengthening military security. 

However, his first presidential term was marked by some difficulties and opposition from political opponents.  In 2019, Ghani was re-elected for a second term, but a few months later, he was forced to resign due to political protests and popular dissatisfaction. 

Despite his resignation, Ghani continues to be an influential figure in Afghan political life.  He is actively involved in public activities and human rights protection, as well as supporting various initiatives for peace and stabilizing the situation in Afghanistan.
Salman of Saudi Arabia:
Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud was born on December 31, 1935 in Riyadh, the capital of Saudi Arabia.  He is the monarch and the eighth king of Saudi Arabia, belonging to the ruling Al Saud dynasty. 

In his youth, Salman Al Saud received education at the Royal Saudi Academy, where he studied religion and humanities.  After completing his studies, he actively engaged in the country's social and political life. 

In 1955, Salman Al Saud was appointed as the governor of Riyadh, marking the beginning of his political career.  In 2011, he became the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defense. 

In January 2015, following the death of his brother King Abdullah, Salman Al Saud was proclaimed the king of Saudi Arabia.  He continued the policies of his predecessor, focusing on the country's economic development and reforms. 

Salman Al Saud is also a key player on the international stage.  He actively supports cooperation with his allies in the Gulf Cooperation Council, as well as with other countries. 

The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia pursues an active policy in the Middle East, and Salman Al Saud plays an important role in diplomatic efforts to resolve conflicts and support stability in the region. 

Salman Al Saud also contributes to the development of education and culture in his country.  He has established several universities and funds supporting talented students and scientific research. 

One of his main achievements is Vision 2030 - a development program aimed at reducing Saudi Arabia's dependency on oil and developing other sectors of the economy. 

Salman Al Saud is a man who has dedicated his life to the development and prosperity of Saudi Arabia.  He is a decisive and energetic leader who seeks to make long-term changes in his country and influence international politics.
Islam Karimov:
Islam Abduganievich Karimov was the first President of independent Uzbekistan from 1990 to 2016.  He was born on January 30, 1938, in the city of Samarkand, Uzbekistan, into a working-class family.  In 1960, Karimov graduated from Tashkent State University, obtaining a higher education in economics and engineering. 

At the beginning of his career, Karimov worked in the industrial and economic sectors in Uzbekistan.  In 1989, he was elected as the Chairman of the Council of Ministers of Uzbekistan.  In 1990, after Uzbekistan gained independence from the Soviet Union, Karimov was elected as the first President of the republic and held this position until his death in September 2016. 

As President, Karimov was known for his authoritarian policies and concentrating power in his hands.  He governed the country with a strong emphasis on stability and security, but this approach was often accompanied by human rights violations and a lack of political pluralism. 

During Karimov's rule, Uzbekistan faced a number of economic, social, and political challenges.  However, he also implemented reforms aimed at developing the economy and improving the lives of citizens.  Under his leadership, economic diversification, improvement in education and healthcare, as well as infrastructure development, were achieved. 

Karimov passed away on September 2, 2016, following a stroke.  After his death, he was succeeded by President Shavkat Mirziyoyev, who became the second President of independent Uzbekistan.
Najib Razak:
Najib Razak was born on July 23, 1953 in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, in the family of the politician and businessman Abdul Razak Hussein - the first Prime Minister of Malaysia. 

In 1974, Najib Razak graduated from the University of Malaysia with a degree in Economics, after which he was admitted to the University of Cambridge in the United Kingdom, where he obtained a bachelor's degree in Ethics, Politics, and Economics. 

Upon returning to Malaysia in 1976, Najib Razak began his political career by participating in the National Front, an organization consisting of the main political parties in Malaysia.  As an active member of the UMNO party (United Malay National Organization), Razak was elected as a Member of Parliament in 1976, representing the Pekan constituency. 

From 1982 to 2009, Najib Razak held various cabinet positions, including Secretary of the Ministry of Culture, Youth and Sports, Minister of Education, Minister of Defense, and Minister of Finance.  Thanks to his skills and experience in economics, Razak was able to implement several important reforms in Malaysia, contributing to the country's development and attracting foreign investments. 

In 2009, Najib Razak was elected as the 6th Prime Minister of Malaysia, succeeding Abdullah Ahmad Badawi.  During his tenure, Razak aimed to strengthen economic growth, improve infrastructure, develop the social sector, and combat corruption.  He initiated the "National Transformation Program", which helped transform Malaysia into a modern and developing country. 

However, his political career was marred by allegations of corruption and involvement in financial irregularities in the Malaysian infrastructure development corporation 1MDB.  Razak was forced to resign in 2018 after being defeated in the elections. 

Known for his obedience and diplomatic skills, Najib Razak has left his mark on the political and economic history of Malaysia.  He has been recognized as one of the influential leaders in the region and continues to be involved in political activities.
Abdrabbuh Mansur Hadi:
Abd Rabbuh Mansur Hadi is a political figure and former President of Yemen.  He was born in 1945 in the city of Shibam, in the south of the country.  Hadi began his political career through military service, joining the Yemeni army at a young age. 

In 1978, Abd Rabbuh Mansur Hadi was appointed governor of the Hadhramaut Governorate.  Subsequently, he earned trust and became the chairman of the Yemeni Anti-Corruption Association.  In 1994, he was appointed Vice President, showcasing his leadership and managerial skills. 

In 2012, after a blockade in national politics and armed conflict, Hadi was elected President of Yemen.  He became the first president after the unification of North and South Yemen in 1990.  During this time, the country was ruled by various factions and clans, and Hadi faced serious challenges. 

During his presidency, Yemen faced a series of social, political, and economic problems.  In 2014, the Houthi group, a pro-Russian Shiite group, seized the capital, Sanaa.  Following this, Hadi was forced to resign and leave the country. 

Since then, Abd Rabbuh Mansur Hadi has been living in exile but continues to be a key figure in Yemen's political sphere.  His role and influence in the country remain significant, especially regarding the internal conflict and civil war in Yemen. 

Abd Rabbuh Mansur Hadi's biography testifies to his long and diverse political career, from military service to leading the country.  His role and impact on dynamics in Yemen continue to be the subject of active debates and analysis.
Sushil Koirala:
Sushil Koirala (born January 25, 1959) is a Nepali writer, poet, and playwright.  He is known for his significant contribution to Nepali literature and his authorial talent, which has gained recognition on the international stage. 

Sushil Koirala was born in the village of Pachkhaya, located in the Ilam district of Nepal.  His passion for literature emerged at an early age, and he began writing poems and stories while still in school.  Koirala was impressed and inspired by the historical events and culture of his country, which often reflected in his writings. 

In 1980, Sushil Koirala published his first notable collection of poems, which brought him recognition and success.  Soon after, he became known for his artistic works of various genres - novels, plays, and films.  His books have been translated into different languages and have received wide resonance and acclaim, both among readers in Nepal and beyond. 

Sushil Koirala is a laureate of several literary awards and honorary titles.  His work often challenges complex social, political, and cultural issues faced by his compatriots.  In his works, he raises relevant questions about identity, nationalism, violence, and tradition, sparking debates and reflections. 

Today, Sushil Koirala remains an active member of the Nepali cultural scene and works as a writer and critic.  His works continue to inspire and engage readers worldwide with their unique perspective and boldness to confront social injustices. 

Sushil Koirala is not only an outstanding writer but also a progressive thinker who uses his art to convey profound messages and change public opinion.  His insightfulness and reputation continue to grow, and his works remain an important element of Nepali literature.
Vladimir Putin:
Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin is a Russian politician who has held high positions in the state since 1999.  He was born on October 7, 1952 in Leningrad (now St.  Petersburg).  His father, Vladimir Spiridonovich Putin, was a submariner, and his mother, Maria Ivanovna Putin, worked in a factory.  Vladimir, the eldest, was the third of three children in the family. 

In 1970, Putin entered Leningrad State University, where he studied at the Faculty of Law.  In 1975, he successfully completed his studies and received his diploma.  Immediately after graduating from university, he joined the ranks of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union. 

In 1991, Putin began his political career by becoming the Deputy Mayor of St.  Petersburg for External Affairs and Cultural Relations.  In 1996, he led the campaign headquarters of presidential candidate Alexander Lebed.  However, Lebed did not win the elections, so Putin redirected his efforts to assist Boris Yeltsin. 

In 1999, Putin became the Prime Minister of Russia under President Boris Yeltsin.  In December 1999, Yeltsin announced his resignation and suggested that Putin take his place.  On December 31, 1999, Vladimir Putin became the Acting President of the Russian Federation. 

In 2000, Putin won the presidential elections and officially assumed the position of head of state.  He was then elected President of Russia two more times, in 2004 and 2012.  In 2008, Putin was appointed Prime Minister of Russia, and he returned to the presidency in 2012.  In 2018, he was re-elected for a fourth term. 

Under Putin's leadership, Russia has undergone numerous political, economic, and social changes.  In foreign policy, Putin has actively advocated for Russia's sovereignty and independence, strengthening its position on the international stage.  Within the country, during his tenure, extensive reforms have taken place in various sectors such as the economy, education, and healthcare. 

Vladimir Putin is considered one of the most influential politicians in the world.  He is often criticized for his policy towards the opposition and human rights violations.  At the same time, some of his supporters view him as a charismatic and strong leader capable of leading the country towards development and prosperity.
Joachim Gauck:
Joachim Gauck (born on April 10, 1961 in Vienna, Austria) is an Austrian composer and conductor. 

Gauck began studying music in early childhood and was captivated by classical music.  At the age of 6, he started playing the piano, and at 10, he performed for the first time with a symphony orchestra.  His talent and passion for music were noticed early, and he was accepted into the Vienna Music Academy for further education. 

After completing his studies at the academy and obtaining a diploma as a pianist, Gauck continued his education at the German Music Academy in Berlin, where he studied composition and conducting.  Here he received an excellent education and was able to establish himself as an outstanding musician. 

In 1985, Gauck joined the Winter Opera Theater in Berlin, where he worked as an assistant conductor.  From that time on, his career began to rapidly evolve.  He started performing regularly with leading orchestras around the world, such as the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra, the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra, and the New York Philharmonic Orchestra. 

In 1991, Gauck was appointed as the chief conductor of the Dresden Philharmonic, one of the most prestigious and well-known orchestras in Germany.  Under his leadership, the orchestra gained even more recognition and acclaim. 

Throughout his career, Gauck became known for his interpretations of works by Gustav Mahler, Johann Strauss, Antonio Vivaldi, and many other composers.  His conducting mastery and musical vision allow him to infuse works with new power and depth. 

Joachim Gauck is not only a talented musician, but also an active supporter of classical music.  He actively supports young musicians and encourages the development of music education programs.  He also organizes charity concerts and does everything possible to attract new audiences to classical music. 

Today, Joachim Gauck is considered one of the greatest conductors of his generation and continues to delight music lovers around the world with his unique interpretations of classical music.  His passion for music and profound understanding of each piece make him unparalleled in his art.
David Cameron:
David Cameron is a British politician who was born on October 9, 1966 in London, United Kingdom.  He is a well-known economist and political figure in the country.  Cameron spent his school and university life in Oxford, where he received his higher education. 

After graduating from university, Cameron began his political career in the Conservative Party of Great Britain.  In 2001, he was elected to the House of Commons and became one of the most prominent representatives of his party. 

Cameron continued to influence the political sphere of Great Britain, and in 2005 he was elected leader of the Conservative Party.  He implemented a series of reforms within his party, making it more appealing and modern for voters. 

In 2010, Cameron became the Prime Minister of Great Britain after the Conservative Party's victory in the elections.  He tackled issues of economic crisis and budget deficit, as well as embarked on reforming the healthcare and education systems. 

However, the most significant event in Cameron's political career was the referendum on the United Kingdom's exit from the European Union, which took place in 2016.  After losing in this referendum, Cameron announced his resignation from the position of Prime Minister. 

Currently, David Cameron continues to engage in active public activities, including writing books and giving lectures.  He remains one of the leading political figures in Great Britain, whose actions and reforms have had a significant impact on the country's political life.
Fran\u00e7ois Hollande:
François Hollande was born on August 12, 1954 in the city of Rouen, France.  He grew up in a family of a medical worker and an English language teacher.  Hollande received an excellent education and graduated from the National School of Administration in Paris. 

In 1981, Hollande became a member of the French Socialist Party.  He became one of the closest allies of Jean-Pierre Raffarin, who became the President of France in 2012.  Hollande was elected as a deputy of the National Assembly in 1988 and was re-elected in 1997 and 2002. 

Hollande held various positions in the government, including the Mayor of Toulouse from 2001 to 2008.  In 2011, he was elected as the party leader and became the Socialist candidate for the presidential elections in 2012. 

Hollande won the presidential elections and became the 24th head of the French state.  During his presidency, he focused on issues such as strengthening the economy, combating unemployment, and easing internal and external conflicts. 

Hollande was also actively contested during his presidency.  Some of his political decisions sparked debates and criticism from the opposition and the public.  Furthermore, his presidential term was marked by increasing terrorism in France, including a series of attacks in Paris in 2015. 

François Hollande completed his first presidential term in 2017 and chose not to run for re-election.  Today, he continues to be active in politics and works as a public figure and commentator.  He is also the author of several books in which he describes his political views and management experience.
Sergio Mattarella:
Sergio Mattarella was born on July 23, 1941 in the city of Palermo, on the island of Sicily, Italy.  He comes from a political family, his father Bernardo Mattarella was a well-known anti-fascist and activist of the Italian left opposition. 

Sergio Mattarella spent his youth in Palermo, where he completed school and enrolled in university.  In 1964, he obtained a bachelor's degree in law from the University of Palermo and began his career as a lawyer. 

In 1975, Mattarella entered politics, joining the Democratic Party and starting to work as a member of the regional parliament of Sicily.  In 1983, he was elected as a member of the Italian Chamber of Deputies and held this position until 2008. 

Throughout his political career, Mattarella held various positions in the Italian government.  He served as Minister of Public Education in the governments of Massimo D'Alema and Romano Prodi, as well as Minister of Defense in the D'Alema government and Minister of Justice in the Enrico Letta government. 

However, the most well-known and important role in Mattarella's political career was his appointment as the President of Italy.  On January 31, 2015, he was elected as the 12th President of Italy following the resignation of the previous President Giorgio Napolitano.  Thus, Mattarella became a symbol of stability and reliability in Italian politics. 

Under his leadership, Italy faced challenges such as economic downturn, rising inequality, and the growth of populist movements.  Mattarella was known for his constitutional principles, fairness, and commitment to the unity of the Italian people. 

Sergio Mattarella served as the President of Italy for a second and final term until 2022, after which he was assassinated on January 10, 2022 in Rome by a defender during a demonstration.  His death caused shock and deep sorrow in Italy and beyond, and he was buried with full state honors to the sound of music and the Italian national anthem. 

The biography of Sergio Mattarella and his dedication to Italian politics have made him an important figure in the history of Italy, and his legacy continues to live on and inspire many people.
Mariano Rajoy:
Mariano Rajoy (born on March 27, 1970 in the city of Sanlúcar de Barrameda, Spain) is a Spanish politician and economist who became the Prime Minister of Spain in 2018. 

Rajoy was born into a family of entrepreneurs and spent most of his childhood in the city of Málaga.  He graduated from college in Madrid, where he studied economics and political science.  During his studies, he became an active participant in the student movement and joined the youth organization of the Spanish Socialist Workers' Party (PSOE). 

After completing his education, Rajoy began working in the private sector, holding high positions in finance and business.  Soon, his talent and ambition for a political career led him to global politics. 

In 2004, Rajoy was elected as a deputy in the Spanish Parliament representing the province of Cádiz.  Over the years, he held various positions in the government, including Minister of Transport, Housing and Urban Development, as well as Vice President. 

In June 2014, Rajoy was elected Secretary-General of the Spanish Socialist Workers' Party (PSOE).  With his appointment to this position, the party began modernizing and reforming its political platform, focusing on social justice and solidarity. 

In 2018, Rajoy led a successful mission to form a new government after the resignation of the Spanish Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy.  In the new cabinet, Rajoy also serves as the Minister for the Prime Minister's Office. 

Mariano Rajoy is known for his socialist views and persistence in reforming the Spanish political system.  He strives to reduce inequality, streamline bureaucracy, and strengthen social protection for all Spanish citizens. 

In addition to his political activities, Rajoy is the author of several books on politics and economics, and he often lectures and speaks at conferences. 

Mariano Rajoy remains an important figure in Spanish politics, continuing to fight for reforms and social justice in Spain.  His leadership and dedication to socialist values make him one of the influential politicians in the country.
Petro Poroshenko:
Petro Poroshenko, full name Petro Oleksiyovych Poroshenko, is a Ukrainian politician and businessman, born on September 26, 1965 in Bolhrad, Odessa Oblast, Ukrainian SSR. 

Poroshenko started his political career in the early 1990s, when he became an adviser to the first President of Ukraine, Leonid Kravchuk.  In 1998, he was appointed as the first Deputy Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine, and then, in 2000, he became the Chairman of the National Security and Defense Council. 

However, Poroshenko is also known for his successful business career.  In 1990, he founded the confectionery company "Roshen," which became one of the largest candy producers in Ukraine and abroad.  Poroshenko also has interests in other sectors of the economy, such as automotive, shipbuilding, and medical industries. 

In 2012, Poroshenko entered politics with the creation of the party "Solidarity," and in 2014, he became the President of Ukraine.  As the head of state, he became a strong supporter of democratic and Euro-Atlantic reforms, aimed at strengthening ties with the European Union and NATO. 

During Poroshenko's presidency, Ukraine faced difficulties with internal conflict and economic crisis.  He was also an active opponent of Russia's annexation of Crimea and the war in eastern Ukraine, which started in 2014.  Poroshenko also focused on fighting corruption and implemented some reforms, although he faced criticism for inefficiency and lack of progress in this area. 

In 2019, Poroshenko was defeated in the presidential elections by a new candidate, Volodymyr Zelensky.  After that, he returned to his business career and actively participates in the political life of Ukraine.
Andrzej Duda:
Andrzej Duda was born on May 16, 1972 in Krakow, Poland.  He is a Polish politician and has been the President of Poland since his election in 2015. 

Duda received a bachelor's degree in law from the University of Warsaw and later obtained a doctoral degree in law from the Jagiellonian University.  After that, he worked as a lawyer in the Office of the President of Poland and taught law at the University of Warsaw. 

Andrzej Duda began his political career in 2006 when he became a member of Law and Justice, a conservative, right-center party.  In 2014, he was chosen as the party's candidate for the President of Poland. 

In 2015, Duda won the presidential elections and was inaugurated as President on August 6, 2015.  During his campaign, he promised to reform the judicial system, strengthen national security, and support economic growth. 

While Andrzej Duda is considered a conservative politician, he also supports some progressive ideas such as gender equality and the protection of LGBTQ rights. 

In 2020, Andrzej Duda ran for re-election as President and won the elections with 51% of the votes.  His second term as President started in the same year. 

Andrzej Duda remains an important figure in Polish politics and a President during significant challenges such as the COVID-19 pandemic and growing tensions between the European Union and Poland.  He continues his work to strengthen Poland's role in international politics and fulfill his promises to the electorate.
Klaus Iohannis:
Klaus Iohannis, whose full name is Klaus Iohannis, was born on June 18, 1959 in the Romanian city of Sibiu.  He is a Romanian politician and has been the President of Romania since 2014. 

Iohannis was born into a German family and grew up in a small town in Transylvania.  He graduated from the Faculty of Physics and Engineering in Timișoara, where he later worked as a physics teacher.  In his professional career, he held various leadership positions in the field of education, remaining closely connected with educational institutions. 

Klaus Iohannis' political career began in 2000 when he became the mayor of Sibiu.  For his achievements in city management, he was appointed as the chairman of the Coalition for the Modernization of Romania and was elected as the president of the Union of Romanian Municipalities in 2012. 

In 2014, Klaus Iohannis ran as a candidate for the presidency of Romania representing the Pro-European Coalition.  His campaign focused on combating corruption and attracting investments to the country.  Despite being a relatively unknown national politician, Iohannis was able to popularize his campaign and won the second round of the presidential elections, defeating his opponent. 

Throughout his presidency, Klaus Iohannis aims to strengthen Romania's economy and implement reforms in education and healthcare.  He also actively supports the European Union and cooperation with other countries.  Iohannis is known for his moderate views and transparent policies, and his leadership style is recognized both within the country and beyond its borders. 

Klaus Iohannis continues to hold the position of President of Romania and works for the benefit of his country, initiating reforms and supporting political stability.  His biography serves as an example of how a person from a small town can achieve success in politics and serve his people.
Mark Rutte:
Mark Ryutte was born on September 17, 1961 in Amsterdam, Netherlands.  Since childhood, he showed interest in art and creativity, so after finishing school, he entered the Amsterdam Academy of Arts, where he studied painting and graphics. 

In his works, Mark strives to convey the beauty of nature and the surrounding world.  His creations are characterized by bright colors, emotionality, and expressiveness.  He mainly works with oil on canvas, creating incredibly detailed landscapes and portraits. 

Throughout his career, Mark Ryutte has held numerous solo exhibitions both in the Netherlands and abroad.  His works have been recognized and appreciated in Europe as well as in other parts of the world.  His portfolio includes works displayed in various museums and galleries, as well as in private collections. 

One of the key themes to which Ryutte pays special attention is environmental protection.  He believes that art plays an important role in drawing attention to ecological issues and evokes an emotional response from viewers.  In his works, he often portrays natural landscapes and animals to remind people of their beauty and value. 

In addition to his work as an artist, Mark Ryutte is actively involved in teaching, leading painting workshops and seminars.  He shares his skills and knowledge with others, helping them to develop and unleash their creative potential. 

Mark Ryutte is a recognized and respected artist, his works evoke emotions and admiration from viewers.  He continues to create beautiful pieces and contribute to the world of art.  Mark Ryutte's biography is filled with creativity, dedication, and love for nature, and he continues to inspire others with his talent and dedication.
Charles Michel:
Charles Michel, full name Charles Yves Jean Ghislaine Michel, is a Belgian politician born on December 21, 1975 in Namur, Belgium.  He served as the 54th Prime Minister of Belgium from October 27, 2019 to October 1, 2020. 

Michel began his political career in the early 2000s by joining the political party Reformist Movement.  In 2004, he was elected to the Belgian Chamber of Representatives and became one of the youngest members of parliament.  From 2007 to 2011, his political career saw continued growth as he held various positions in the government, including Minister of Development and Minister of Digital Policy. 

In 2014, Michel was appointed as the Prime Minister of Belgium, leading a government coalition of Flemish nationalists and liberals.  During his tenure as Prime Minister, Michel focused on economic reforms, reducing the country's budget deficit, and strengthening Belgium's identity within the European project. 

However, contentious issues such as immigration policy and tax reforms led to protests and lack of opposition support for Michel's government.  As a result of unresolved disputes on these matters, the government resigned in December 2018.  Subsequent negotiations to form a new government led to Michel being replaced by Alexander De Croo as Prime Minister. 

Following this, Michel became the President of the European Council, assuming office on December 1, 2019.  This position allows him to play a role in shaping political decisions within the European Union and regularly setting the agendas for EU summits. 

Overall, Charles Michel is an experienced politician who attracts attention with his youth and energy.  His political career continues, and he continues to play an important role in Belgian and European politics.
Milo\u0161 Zeman:
Miloš Zeman was born on September 28, 1944 in the town of Kolín, Czechoslovakia (now Czech Republic).  He is a Czech politician and statesman who has served as the President of the Czech Republic since 2013. 

Zeman graduated in economics from the Prague Economic Institute and then received a scholarship to study international monetary relations at the Moscow Institute of International Relations. 

In 1968, during the Prague Spring, Zeman joined the Communist Party of Czechoslovakia.  He later became known as a reformist president of the student council at the Prague Economic Institute. 

In 1989, during the Velvet Revolution, Zeman made a bold move by leaving the Communist Party and joining the Social Democrats.  He quickly demonstrated his political talent and emerged as a leading Social Democratic politician in Czechoslovakia and later in the Czech Republic. 

In 1993, he was appointed as the Chairman of the Czech National Standards Organization, which tasked Zeman with negotiating with the European Union regarding Czechia's accession to the organization.  He played a key role in the success of the negotiations and Czechia's inclusion in the EU in 2004. 

In 2013, Miloš Zeman was elected as the President of the Czech Republic after defeating his opponent Karel Schwarzenberg.  He took the oath on March 8, 2013, becoming the first directly elected President of the Czech Republic. 

During his presidency, Zeman emerged as a controversial figure, expressing strong nationalist and pro-Serbian views.  Despite criticisms and controversies, Miloš Zeman remains a popular and influential figure in Czech politics. 

Miloš Zeman has been honored with four birthdays and honorary doctorates from several universities.  In his free time, he enjoys traveling, reading, and pursuing cultural and historical interests.
Prokopis Pavlopoulos:
Prokopis Pavlopoulos was born on July 11, 1973 in Athens, Greece.  He is a well-known Greek actor and producer. 

Pavlopoulos started his career in theatre in the early 1990s.  He performed in various plays in the theatre and gained recognition from audiences and critics for his talented acting and versatility in roles. 

In 1995, he starred in his first film "Dandelions", which received international recognition and nominations at several film festivals.  For his role in this film, Pavlopoulos was awarded the Best Actor award at the Greek Film Festival. 

Since then, he has appeared in many Greek films and has become one of the most well-known actors of his generation.  He continues to work in both film and television, and his talent and professionalism are recognized both in Greece and abroad. 

In addition to his acting career, Pavlopoulos is also a successful producer.  He founded his own film studio and produced films that received high praise from critics and performed well at the box office. 

Prokopis Pavlopoulos is actively involved in the public life of Greece.  He supports various charitable projects and organizations, as well as advocates for animal rights. 

Today, he is considered one of the most influential and talented performers in Greece, and his work is always appreciated by audiences and critics.
Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa:
Marcelo Vieira da Silva Santos (born on September 14, 1987) is a Brazilian footballer who plays as a defender. 

Marcelo was born in São Luís, Maranhão, Brazil.  He began his football career in the youth academy of a local club.  Quickly demonstrating his talent and potential, Marcelo was noticed by scouts from well-known Brazilian and European clubs. 

In 2006, Marcelo signed a contract with the Brazilian club "São Paulo".  Here he spent several years training and developing before joining the main team.  During his time at "São Paulo", Marcelo became known for his athletic abilities, speed, and aggressive playing style. 

In 2007, Marcelo caught the attention of the Italian club "Internazionale", which acquired him for a significant sum.  He immediately became an important part of the team and played a crucial role in the club's success on both national and international levels.  With Marcelo, "Internazionale" won several Serie A titles, the Coppa Italia, and the Supercoppa Italiana. 

In 2017, Marcelo moved to the Spanish club "Real Madrid".  Here he continued to demonstrate a high level of play and became one of the leading defenders of the team.  With "Real Madrid", Marcelo won numerous titles including La Liga championships, the UEFA Champions League, and the FIFA Club World Cup. 

Marcelo has also been a member of the Brazilian national football team since 2006.  He has represented his country in many tournaments, including the World Cup and the Copa America.  The Brazilian national team has achieved great success, with Marcelo considered one of the key players on the team. 

Marcelo has a huge number of fans and followers worldwide thanks to his talent, dedication, and contribution to football.  He remains one of the most respected and well-known defenders of his generation.
Stefan L\u00f6fven:
Stefan Leven (born on October 10, 1903 in Budapest, Hungary) was one of the most renowned psychologists of his time.  He is known for his work in the field of personality development and psychological counseling. 

Leven studied at the philosophical faculty of the University of Berlin, where he studied psychology and philosophy.  In the same university, he obtained a PhD in philosophy in 1926 for his dissertation on the psychology of reasoning and its application to social sciences. 

After defending his dissertation, Leven worked in various scientific institutes in Europe.  In 1933, he emigrated to the United States due to the rise of the Nazis in Germany.  In the USA, he taught psychology at various universities and became a popular lecturer and psychological consultant. 

Leven's main contribution to psychology lies in the development of the theory of personality and the method of psychological counseling, which he called "biography".  He believed that each person's personality is formed as a result of their biographical experience, and that this experience can be explored and used to help people in their development and self-awareness. 

In his works, Leven also focused on the concept of "creativity," which he considered a key aspect of personal development.  He developed a methodology called "search for meaning in life," which helped people determine their values and life goals. 

Throughout his career, Leven wrote numerous articles and books that have become classics in the field of psychology.  He was also an active member of various psychological organizations and societies, including the American Psychological Association. 

Stepan Leven passed away on October 16, 1979 in the USA, leaving behind a significant legacy and contribution to the field of psychological science.  His works are still relevant and in demand among specialists in the field of psychology and psychotherapy.
J\u00e1nos \u00c1der:
János Áder was born on May 9, 1959, in the city of Csornaújtelep, into a family of ordinary workers.  From childhood, he showed a great interest in nature and ecology, which became decisive in his future choice of profession. 

In 1983, János Áder graduated from the University of Pécs with a degree in ecology.  After that, he started working at the National Institute of Environmental Protection, where he was involved in research and development of various nature conservation projects. 

In 1990, Áder was elected as a member of the Hungarian National Assembly from the "Green Alternatives" party.  His sharp, conscientious, and intellectual approach to solving environmental problems attracted the attention of many political figures in the country. 

Throughout his political career, János Áder held various positions, including Minister of Environment and Water Resources.  He actively supported measures to combat water pollution, promote renewable energy sources, as well as protect biodiversity and ecosystems. 

In 2012, Áder was elected President of Hungary.  During his presidency, he continued to pursue an active policy in the field of environmental protection, supporting measures to reduce carbon emissions, develop environmentally friendly technologies, and protect natural reserves. 

János Áder also actively participates in various international environmental forums, aiming to ensure sustainable development and conservation of nature not only in Hungary but also worldwide.  His efforts in the field of environmental protection are recognized both nationally and internationally. 

Being a prominent ecologist and politician, János Áder dedicates his life to the fight for environmental conservation and the creation of a sustainable future for future generations.  In his decisions, he relies on scientific research and the implementation of new technologies to achieve global ecological sustainability.
Alexander Lukashenko:
Alexander Grigorievich Lukashenko was born on August 30, 1954 in the village of Kopys in the Brest region of the Belarusian Soviet Socialist Republic.  Official information about his childhood and early years of life is not detailed enough. 

In 1975, Lukashenko graduated from the Mogilev Pedagogical Institute with a degree in physics and mathematics education.  After completing his studies, he worked as a teacher in a school for several years, and later as a professor at the Mogilev Pedagogical Institute. 

In 1990, Lukashenko began his political career by becoming a deputy of the Supreme Soviet of the Belarusian SSR.  The next step in his political career was becoming the chairman of the collective farm "Selektsiya" in the Mogilev region.  During this time, Lukashenko became known for his sharp statements regarding bureaucracy, corruption, and critics of the regime. 

In 1994, Lukashenko was elected President of Belarus and has since held onto power for many years.  During his rule, he introduced a series of authoritarian measures and restructured the political system, concentrating power in his hands.  During subsequent presidential elections, Lukashenko consistently received the majority of votes and maintained his position as president. 

Under his leadership, Belarus pursued a policy aimed at economic independence from Russia and strengthening national identity.  However, his rule has also been criticized for human rights violations, state control over mass media, and the absence of a multi-party system. 

Alexander Lukashenko also played an important role in Belarus's international relations.  He participated in the creation of the Eurasian Economic Union and maintained close ties with Russia, despite some disputes and conflicts between the two countries. 

Throughout his rule, Lukashenko has been repeatedly re-elected as President, although his reforms and policies have sparked disagreements and protests within the country and beyond.  In November 2020, presidential elections were held, the results of which led to mass protests and a possible change in the political situation in Belarus. 

Thus, Alexander Lukashenko is one of the longest-serving leaders in the world, with a strong authoritarian style of governance.  His biography and political career evoke various opinions and emotions and continue to be seen as one of the most controversial phenomena in modern Belarusian politics.
Heinz Fischer:
Heinz Fischer was born on December 7, 1932 in Vienna, Austria.  He was an Austrian politician and diplomat, known for his contributions to the development of European integration. 

After graduating from high school, Fischer enrolled at the University of Vienna, where he studied law.  In 1955, he obtained a Doctor of Laws degree.  Throughout his career, Fischer taught at various universities and held several leadership positions in government and international organizations. 

In 1983, Heinz Fischer was elected as a member of the National Parliament for the Social Democratic Party of Austria (SPÖ).  In 1987, he became Minister of Science and Research, and in 1990, he was appointed Vice-Chancellor of the Austrian Republic.  During his political career, he held several key positions in the government, including Minister of Foreign Affairs and Security Advisor. 

One of Heinz Fischer's most significant roles was his involvement in the development of European integration.  In 1995, he was appointed Austria's official representative to the European Union and later became its permanent representative.  During his tenure, he actively participated in diplomatic and political negotiations that contribute to the strengthening and expansion of European integration. 

Heinz Fischer also had a significant influence on the development of international relations and Austria's involvement in world politics.  He represented Austria at many key international forums, such as the United Nations and the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe. 

In addition to his political and diplomatic achievements, Fischer is also the author of several books and articles on politics and international relations.  He received several awards and honorary titles for his contributions to peacebuilding and the resolution of international conflicts. 

Heinz Fischer left a significant legacy as one of the outstanding politicians and diplomats of his time.  His work and contributions to European integration and international relations remain important and relevant to this day.  Fischer passed away on July 29, 2021, at the age of 88, leaving behind a rich political legacy.
Simonetta Sommaruga:
Simonetta Sommaruga was born on March 23, 1973 in the city of Lugano, Switzerland.  She is of Italian descent and grew up in a family where art was always a present element.  Her father was a talented artist, and her mother was a musician, which inspired Simonetta to be creative from a young age. 

In her youth, Simonetta showed interest in acting and poetry.  She attended acting school and began studying the art of acting.  Thanks to her dedication and talent, Simonetta quickly caught the attention of critics and audiences, and her career began to develop at a fast pace. 

In 1995, Sommaruga starred in her first major role on the big screen, in the Italian film "Charles, My Love".  Her talent and expressiveness caught the attention of viewers and critics, and Simonetta received several prestigious awards for her work in this film. 

The following years were overshadowed by professional and personal difficulties for Simonetta.  She faced criticism about her appearance and not fitting the Hollywood beauty standards, but despite this, Sommaruga did not give up and continued to work on herself and her craft. 

Soon Simonetta starred in the film "A Window in the Parisian Courtyard" in 2006, where her talent and professionalism were recognized by critics.  The film brought her worldwide fame and numerous awards, including the "Best Actress" award at the Venice Film Festival. 

Today Simonetta Sommaruga remains one of the most talented and sought-after actresses in the world of cinema.  Her skill and unique appearance have made her a symbol of natural beauty and emotional depth on screen. 

In addition to cinema, Sommaruga is also actively involved in public activities, supporting various charitable projects and organizations related to art and culture. 

Simonetta Sommaruga continues to advance her career, appearing in films and TV series of various genres and countries, never ceasing to amaze and impress her fans with her talent and distinct charisma.  Her name remains one of the most significant in the world of the film industry.
Rosen Plevneliev:
Rosen Plevneliev is a Bulgarian politician and former President of the Republic of Bulgaria.  He was born on May 14, 1964, in the city of Pleven. 

Plevneliev graduated in Economics and International Relations from Sofia University "St.  Kliment Ohridski" in 1989.  Additionally, he also underwent training at the National Academy of Public Administration in France and at the Institute for Political Studies in Belgium. 

After completing his education, Plevneliev entered the official structures of the Bulgarian government.  He started his career as a civil servant at the Ministry of International Economic Relations and the Ministry of the Economy.  From 2001 to 2009, he served as an economic and political adviser to President Georgi Parvanov. 

In 2009, Plevneliev was elected Vice President of the European Investment Bank (EIB) and joined the institution in 2010.  He remained in this position until 2011 when he resigned to run for President of Bulgaria. 

In the presidential elections of 2011, Plevneliev ran as a candidate from the party "GERB" and won with the support of 52. 58% of the voters.  He took office as the President of the Republic of Bulgaria on January 22, 2012. 

Plevneliev's presidential mandate was focused on improving Bulgaria's internal and external relations.  He actively worked to enhance Bulgaria's prestige and role in the European Union and NATO.  However, his efforts to reform the judicial system and fight corruption did not yield the expected results. 

After the end of his mandate in 2017, Plevneliev withdrew from politics and engaged in consultancy activities and business projects.  He remains active in the public life of Bulgaria and continues to support reforms and processes aimed at modernizing the country.
Muhammadu Buhari:
Muhammad al-Bukhari was an Uzbek politician and a prominent figure in the field of Islamic law.  He was born on October 4, 1449 in the city of Bukhara, which was then part of Khwarezm.  Being an excellent student, al-Bukhari received education in local madrasas and continued his studies in major Islamic centers in the territory of modern Uzbekistan. 

At the age of 18, he began travelling to countries in Eastern and Central Asia to study various schools of Islamic jurisprudence.  He studied and taught in different cities, including Herat, Mashhad, Khwarezm, and others. 

In 1498, al-Bukhari returned to his hometown and founded his famous work, "Sahih al-Bukhari. " This collection of hadiths is one of the most authoritative works in Sunni Islam.  To create this collection, al-Bukhari studied and classified over 600,000 hadiths, selecting only those that met strict criteria of authenticity. 

Subsequently, Muhammad al-Bukhari gained recognition and respect as a prominent scholar and authority in the Islamic world.  His collection of hadiths became one of the main sources for Muslim jurists, scholars, and spiritual leaders. 

Al-Bukhari also left behind other works and famous commentaries on various aspects of Islamic law.  He lectured and taught students in many cities in Eastern and Central Asia, contributing to the dissemination of his knowledge and influence on Islamic culture. 

Muhammad al-Bukhari passed away in the year 870 at the age of 62 in the city of Samarkand, where he also taught.  His legacy remains enduring, and his works continue to inspire and influence Muslim scholars and legal experts around the world.
Hailemariam Desalegn:

Abdel Fattah el-Sisi:

Jacob Zuma:

Yoweri Museveni:

Abdelaziz Bouteflika:

Omar al-Bashir:

Mahamadou Issoufou:

Michel Kafando:

Barack Obama:
Barack Obama, whose full name is Barack Hussein Obama II, was born on August 4, 1961, in Honolulu, Hawaii, USA.  He is an American politician and lawyer, who became the 44th President of the United States. 

Obama grew up in a multicultural family.  His mother, Ann Dunham, was a white American of European descent, and his father, Barack Obama Sr. , was a black man from Kenya.  His parents divorced when Barack was still a young boy, and he was raised by his mother.  He spent part of his childhood in Indonesia, where his mother married an Indonesian man.

In 1996, he was elected to the Illinois Senate, where he served for eight years before joining the U. S.  Senate in 2004.  In 2008, he won the presidential election, defeating the Republican candidate, John McCain.  Obama became the first black president in the history of the United States. 

During his first term, Obama focused on issues such as healthcare reform, economic recovery after the 2008 financial crisis, combating climate change, and withdrawing troops from Iraq.  He also took initiatives to improve U. S.  relations with other countries, including Cuba and Iran. 

In 2012, Obama was re-elected for a second term, where he continued his work on reforms in various areas.  During his presidency, legislative acts were passed aimed at reducing inequality, expanding LGBT rights, and strengthening environmental protection. 

After two terms in office, Barack Obama handed over his position to Donald Trump in January 2017, and currently serves on public boards and teaches at Columbia University. 

Barack Obama remains one of the most influential political figures of his time, celebrated for his charisma, morality, and commitment to positive change in society.  His biography and presidential experience inspire many people around the world.
Dilma Rousseff:
Dilma Vana Rousseff, whose full name is Dilma Vana Linhares Rousseff, was born on December 14, 1947 in Belo Horizonte, Brazil.  She is a Brazilian politician and economist, the first female president of Brazil. 

Dilma Rousseff grew up in a family of intellectuals; her father was a well-known Brazilian economist of Danish descent.  Thanks to this, she received a good education and developed an interest in economics.  In 1964, at the age of just 16, Dilma joined the youth movement fighting against the military regime, which led to her active political career. 

In the 1970s, Dilma joined an insurgent organization known as the Brazilian Communist Party.  She was arrested and tortured for her political activities against the military regime.  Dilma spent almost three years in prison, where she was subjected to torture, but managed to remain strong and determined in her fight. 

After her release, Dilma started working in the field of economics, and her career quickly advanced.  In 2002, she was appointed Minister of Energy and began actively working on the development of alternative energy sources in Brazil. 

In 2010, Dilma Rousseff was elected President of Brazil from the Workers' Party.  She became the first woman in the history of Brazil to hold this position.  During her presidency, Dilma focused on the social development of the country, combating inequality and poverty.  She also continued to work on developing alternative energy sources to make Brazil less dependent on foreign oil. 

However, her presidency was marked by scandals involving corruption and an economic downturn.  In 2016, Dilma Rousseff was impeached and removed from office, yielding the presidency to her vice president, Michel Temer. 

Today, Dilma Rousseff continues her political activities and remains an important figure in Brazilian politics.  She continues to actively advocate for women's rights and social justice.
Enrique Pe\u00f1a Nieto:
Enrique Peña Nieto was born on July 20, 1966 in Atlitko, State of Mexico, Mexico.  He grew up in a middle-class family, with his father working in the oil industry and his mother being a housewife.
